title: How to Get the Pause Button Back on Facebook Reels: 8 Methods

steps.title: Delete the Facebook cache on Android.
steps.content: Delete the Facebook cache on Android. Some users have had luck getting the pause button back on reels by clearing their Facebook cache. To clear this cache, however, you'll have to go to your phone's settings: Open your Android's Settings. Tap Apps or Apps & notifications . Tap Facebook . Tap Storage and cache or Storage . Tap Clear cache .

steps.title: Delete the Facebook cache on iOS.
steps.content: Delete the Facebook cache on iOS. If you have an iPhone or iPad, there's no option to clear the Facebook cache . Instead, you'll need to offload the Facebook app and then reinstall it to bring back the ability to pause reels: Open Settings . Tap General . Tap iPhone (or iPad) Storage . Tap Facebook . Tap Offload app and then Offload app again to confirm. Tap Reinstall app .

steps.title: Turn your phone off and back on to refresh it.
steps.content: Turn your phone off and back on to refresh it. Sometimes phones can exhibit weird behaviors if they've been on for a while, so restarting your phone could help fix the issue of the pause button missing from your Facebook reel. Each phone is restarted a little differently but usually involves a combination of button presses with the power button and the volume up or down button.

steps.title: Open the Facebook app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app on your phone or tablet. If you're using the Facebook mobile app, turning off autoplay often restores your ability to pause reels.

steps.title: Tap the Menu button in the lower-right corner.
steps.content: Tap the Menu button in the lower-right corner. This icon looks like three horizontal lines stacked on top of each other.

steps.title: Tap the settings cog in the upper-right corner.
steps.content: Tap the settings cog in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Select Media under Preferences.
steps.content: Select Media under Preferences. This menu item has a small rectangle with a triangle play button in the middle.

steps.title: Select Never Autoplay Videos under Autoplay.
steps.content: Select Never Autoplay Videos under Autoplay. This will turn off autoplay when you open a reel, which may bring the pause functionality back to you.

steps.title: Tap the comment icon when viewing a reel.
steps.content: Tap the comment icon when viewing a reel. The comment icon is on the right side of the screen and looks like a speech bubble. Some users state that tapping the comment icon will bring up a pause icon, which you can then tap to pause the video. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to your phone's app store.
steps.content: Go to your phone's app store. It's possible that not being able to pause reels on Facebook is a bug and Facebook has already pushed a fix in an update. On Android, open the Google Play Store . On iOS, open the App Store .

steps.title: Go to your profile.
steps.content: Go to your profile. On Android, tap your profile picture in the upper right-hand corner. On iOS, tap the blue user button in the upper right-hand corner.

steps.title: Update the TikTok app.
steps.content: Update the TikTok app. How to update varies based on phone type: On Android, click Manage apps & device in your profile. If there are updates available, you'll see Updates available . Tap See details to see if TikTok has an update available, and then hit the Update button next to TikTok if it does. On iOS, scroll until you see TikTok and select the blue Update button.

steps.title: Reopen the app after the update is completed.
steps.content: Reopen the app after the update is completed. If there is no Facebook update available, you will need to try another method to fix the pausing issue.

steps.title: Tap and hold a reel to pause it.
steps.content: Tap and hold a reel to pause it. This is how you pause a reel on Instagram, and it may work on Facebook as well if the normal method to pause videos doesn't work. [2] X Research source If the reel pauses, lift your finger to unpause it.

steps.title: Tap the three-dot icon in the bottom-right corner of a reel.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot icon in the bottom-right corner of a reel. This will bring up the reels menu. Some users reported getting their pause functionality back right after submitting a bug report to Facebook, but this is anecdotal.

steps.title: Select Something went wrong with the bug icon next to it.
steps.content: Select Something went wrong with the bug icon next to it. This will begin the bug report process.

steps.title: Decide whether to include logs and diagnostics or not.
steps.content: Decide whether to include logs and diagnostics or not. You can either opt to provide logs to Facebook or not, but providing logs can help Facebook engineers solve bugs more quickly.

steps.title: Explain what happened.
steps.content: Explain what happened. In the box that says What went wrong? type out the issue you are having by not being able to pause reels.

steps.title: Click Send in the upper-right corner when you're done.
steps.content: Click Send in the upper-right corner when you're done. This will send the bug report to Facebook. You may or may not get a response if Facebook sees your report and if they fix it.

steps.title: Delete and reinstall the Facebook app.
steps.content: Delete and reinstall the Facebook app. If you still can't pause reels, deleting and reinstalling the mobile app will often fix the problem. On Android, tap and hold the Facebook app on the Home screen, then select Uninstall or drag it to the trash icon. On other Androids, you'll need to tap the X or Delete after tapping and holding the icon. Then, download the Facebook app again from the Play Store. On an iPhone or iPad, tap and hold the Facebook icon on your Home screen, tap Remove app , then tap Delete App .
